text: I'm Tim pal I'm the chief director of
the digital economy unit for the Western
Cape provincial government there are two
main initiatives at the moment one of
them as a research study we've just
concluded called skills boost or skills
boost Western Cape and there we had a
look at two fundamental research
questions and they were all centered
around the future of digital jobs in the
Western Cape and what the market is
going to demand in five years time the
second initiative is called the ICANN
the interactive community access network
there we have prototypes a centre in
Elsie's River and we're looking to
expand and replicate this model in
various centers across the Western Cape
we will teach people basic digital
literacy and on to advanced training
courses the CAHSEE initiative works with
townships to enable the residents the
businesses the SMM ease the education
institutions to build to build solutions
in the digital economy to take those to
their own communities to other
communities across South Africa and why
not globally as well too so uniqueness
is from the fact that it allows the
CAHSEE residents to own this program and
build up these were our winners by the
way they won the competition and they
built something very quick and again it
wasn't necessary but the technology but
about solving a problem and creating a
new solution so thank you both
I'm Eddie this is my partner Teddy
testing these we are from Cosette and
close it is the only school in our
Township that teaches IT so we are
really glad to have this opportunity and
to be here in front of you we were
looking at problems in our community and
we found out that small businesses in
our community don't actually have that
much exposure to other people so we
tried creating a website so that they
could reach other people from different
parts of the communities so AWAC Cassie
is not a single intervention but rather
collection of all the aw is resources
and support that's available through our
various programs such as aw is educate
and AWS Academy which is available to
university students as well as students
and youths a free program but there's
also initiatives such as aw is activate
and various startup and atropine or
support programs that are also available
to small businesses solutions such as a
car C are involved bringing technology
into the township they are going to help
folks who live in the townships you can
identify problems and these are
real-world problems match those with
appropriate technology it's going to be
particularly relevant for SMEs going to
take their businesses out to wider
audiences through the awsm Cassie
program will learn service skills like
coding in HTML CSS and JavaScript and
then we created two websites so the most

for the community in the community but
